title: travelplanner: Could you help create a 3-day travel plan for two people? We're traveling from West Palm Beach to White Plains, visiting only one city from March 5th to March 7th, 2022. We have a budget of $2,600. For our accommodations, we'd like rooms that are not shared. We are not planning on self-driving and will be reliant on public transportation. Cuisines we are interested in trying include Mexican, Chinese, Mediterranean, and American. (52b555dd19741792)

always_included_messages.content: Based on the user's query, make the best travel plan for the user and save it. Do not ask follow-up questions.

chat_history.name: attraction_search

chat_history.content:
Day 1:

Flight:
Take Flight F3756085 at 5:58 AM from West Palm Beach to White Plains, arriving at 8:48 AM. This journey will take approximately 2 hours and 50 minutes. The price for this flight is $515.

Accommodation:
Check into a private room in Historic Queens, NY. This accommodation costs $865 for two nights and has a 1.0-star rating. Alternatively, you can choose the Private Theatre District Bedroom, which is $149 for one night and has a 4.0-star rating.

Lunch:
After checking in, head to El Kiosco Mexican Restaurant, which serves Mexican and pizza cuisine and has a 4.2-star rating. It will cost you approximately $65.

Activity:
Visit the J Harvey Turnure Memorial Park, located at 26 Lake St in White Plains, NY 10603. This park offers a peaceful green space for a relaxing afternoon.

Evening Meal:
For dinner, consider Aravalli Owls, which offers pizza, Mediterranean, and BBQ dishes. It has a 0.0-star rating and will cost you around $26.

Day 2:

Breakfast:
Start your day with a visit to Le Marche Sugar & Spice Cafe, serving Indian, desserts, and seafood. You can expect to pay around $30 for this meal.

Activity:
Explore the Percy Grainger House, located at 7 Cromwell Pl, White Plains, NY 10601. This historic site is dedicated to the famous composer and is a great way to immerse yourself in the local culture.

Lunch:
Head to Six Pack Kitchen for lunch. This restaurant offers Chinese, Mexican, desserts, and seafood options and has a 3.2-star rating. The cost for this meal is approximately $58.

Activity:
Spend the afternoon at Saxon Woods Park, a scenic park located at 1800 Mamaroneck Ave, White Plains, NY 10605. It offers various recreational activities and a peaceful atmosphere.

Evening:
For dinner, try Kinoshita, a restaurant serving tea, pizza, fast food, and American cuisine. It has a 3.9-star rating and will cost you around $42.

Day 3:

Breakfast:
Have breakfast at Happy Hakka, which offers desserts, pizza, fast food, and Chinese dishes for around $37.

Activity:
Visit the Neuberger Museum of Art, located at 735 Anderson Hill Rd, Purchase, NY 10577. This museum showcases a range of art exhibits and is a great cultural experience.

Lunch:
Enjoy lunch at The California Boulevard, serving cafe, Mexican, bakery, and dessert options. It has a 4.6-star rating and will cost you approximately $56.

Activity:
Take a stroll through Battle of White Plains Park, located at 76 Battle Ave, White Plains, NY 10606. This park offers a historic glimpse of the area and provides a relaxing ambiance.

Dinner:
For your last meal in White Plains, consider El Cazador, which offers Mexican, pizza, and BBQ cuisine. It has a 3.7-star rating and will cost you around $90.

Remember to book your flights and accommodations in advance to secure the best prices, and feel free to adjust the itinerary based on your preferences! The estimated total cost for this trip, excluding flights, is $1,645 for two people, leaving you with a remaining budget of $955 for any additional expenses or upgrades.

functions.name: accommodation_search
functions.desc:
Discover accommodations in your desired city.
Example: accommodation_search("Rome") would present a list of hotel rooms in Rome.

city.description: The name of the city where you're seeking accommodation.

functions.name: attraction_search
functions.desc:
Find attractions in a city of your choice.
Example: attraction_search("London") would return attractions in London.

city.description: The name of the city where you're seeking attractions.

functions.name: city_search
functions.desc:
Find cities in a state of your choice.
Example: city_search("California") would return cities in California.

state.description: The name of the state where you're seeking cities.

functions.name: flight_search
functions.desc:
A flight information retrieval tool.
Example: flight_search("New York", "London", "2022-10-01") would fetch flights from New York to London on October 1, 2022.

departure_city.description: The city you'll be flying out from.

destination_city.description: The city you aim to reach.

date.description: The date of your travel in YYYY-MM-DD format.

functions.name: google_distance_matrix
functions.desc:
Estimate the distance, time and cost between two cities.
Example: google_distance_matrix("Paris", "Lyon", "self-driving") would provide driving distance, time and cost between Paris and Lyon.

origin.description: The departure city of your journey.

destination.description: The destination city of your journey.

functions.name: restaurant_search
functions.desc:
Explore dining options in a city of your choice.
Example: restaurant_search("Tokyo") would show a curated list of restaurants in Tokyo.

city.description: The name of the city where you're seeking restaurants.

functions.name: submit_day_plan
functions.desc:
Once you have collected information about the trip, call this function once for each day of the trip, starting on day 1.
If a field does not apply for a given day, use "-" to indicate this.
You MUST call this function to save the plan for each query.

current_city.description: The city for this day. If the plan is to travel between two cities, indicate it as "from A to B" (e.g. "from Ithaca to Charlotte").

transportation.description: e.g. "Flight Number: F3633413, from Ithaca to Charlotte, Departure Time: 05:38, Arrival Time: 07:46"

breakfast.description: The name of a restaurant in the city, e.g. "Nagaland's Kitchen, Charlotte"

attraction.description: Use a ";" to separate different attractions, with each attraction formatted as "Name, City". e.g. "The Charlotte Museum of History, Charlotte;"

accommodation.description: e.g. "Affordable Spacious Refurbished Room in Bushwick!, Charlotte"
